title: The two-envelope paradox: an axiomatic approach

references.title: Clark and Shackel on the TwoEnvelope Paradox".
references.raw: Meacham, C. J. G. and Weisberg, J. 2003: "Clark and Shackel on the TwoEnvelope Paradox". Mind 112(448), pp. 685-689.

references.title: The Foundations of Causal Decision Theory. Cambridge:
references.raw: Joyce, J. M. 1999: The Foundations of Causal Decision Theory. Cambridge: Cambridge University Press.

references.title: The two-envelope paradox".
references.raw: Clark, M. and Shackel, N. 2000: "The two-envelope paradox". Mind 109(435), pp. 415-442.

abstract: In this paper, we present a simple axiomatic justification for indifference before opening, avoiding any expectation reasoning, which is often considered problematic in infinite cases. Although the two-envelope paradox assumes an expectation-maximizing agent, we show that analogous paradoxes arise for agents using difierent decision principles such as maximin and maximax, and that our justification for indifierence before opening applies here too
